intro: Meconella californica, commonly known as the California meconella, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Meconella californica is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
